context: Contract: 4 spades. West leads the club King. You win the ace and play which suit?
notes: David Bird, 52 great tips on Declarer play. Tip 2 hand 1

context: Contract: 4 spades. You draw trumps in three rounds and play three top hearts ending in dummy, East having 4H. Which suit do you play next?
You declare 4S after West opened 1H. You winthe HK lead and play which card next?
notes: David Bird 52 great bridge tips tip 6 hand 1

context: You declare 4H after West opens 1S. West leads three top spades. You ruff the third spade with the J, East discarding a diamond. Which suit do you play next?
notes: David bird tips on declarer play tip 6 last hand

context: Against 3NT, West leads the spade 3. You win and hand and play the Ace of clubs and a club, West following low. Do you play the Jack? (Y/N)
notes: david bird tip 7 52 tips on declarer play

context: In 7S, West leads a diamond and East shows out on the first spade. Which card do you play from hand?
notes: david bird 52 tips on declarer play tip 9

context: In 6 spades, West leads the DQ. You win, and play which suit?
East opens 3S. You win the QC lead in dummy and lead which card?

Against 6S west leads the CT. You win and draw trumps in 1 round ending in dummy. Which card do you play from dummy?
In 6S you win the KC lead and draw trumps in 2 rounds. When you play a diamond, do you play the Ace from dummy?
In 4S you win the trump lead and draw trumps in 3 rounds, ending in dummy. Which suit do you play from dummy?
Playing IMPs, you declare 4S on the H2 lead. Do you finesse in spades?
In 4H, West leads the S9, RHO winning the Ace and returning a spade. Do you finesse in hearts?
Against 4S, West leads the HJ. Which card do you play from dummy?
In 3NT, West leads the spade 2. East wins and play the Ace and returns the S3. Which card do you play from your hand?
In 4H, West leads the CK and you win the second club. Which suit do you play now from dummy?
In 4S, West leads the D4. True or false: your best chance to make a 10th trick is in clubs? (Y/N)
East opens 1C and you play 4S. The defense leads 3 rounds of clubs and you ruff the third round. True or false: after drawing trumps, your best play in hearts is Ace and low to the Queen (Y/N)?
West leads the C2 against 4H. Which card do you play from dummy?
West leads the HJ against 4S. Which card do you play from dummy?
West leads the CQ against 3NT, East playing the 5. Which card do you play from your hand?
West leads the DT against 6H. You win in dummy and play a trump, east following low. Which card do you play from the S hand?
West leads the CQ against 6NT. True or false: your best play in hearts is to cash one top honor and then finesse. (Y/N).
West leads the H5 against 6S. You win the HQ with your Ace and play which suit?
Against 4H, West leads three top spades. On the third spade, which suit do you play from your hand?
West leads the C8 against 6S. Which suit do you play next?
You play 3NT after West overcalls 2D. You win West's diamond lead with the jack, east playing the 8. True or false: your best play in clubs is two top clubs (Y/N)?
West leads the S6 against 3NT: 4, 5. Which card do you play from your hand?
West leads the H2 against 3NT: 3, 8. Which card do you play from hand?
West leads the S6 against 3NT: 2, 7. Which card do you play from hand?
Against 3NT, West leads the CQ. True or false: your best play is to overtake the DQ at trick 2 (Y/N)?
Against 6H, West leads the CK. True or false: your best plan is to play two rounds of trumps, one top spade, and then finesse in spades? (Y/N)
In 6H, You win the CJ lead and draw one round of trump. You play a spade from hand. True or false: you should play the Ace from dummy (Y/N).
West leads the 3NT at trick 1. True or false: you should win in the North hand (Y/N)
You play 3NT on the QS lead. True or false: your best play is to duck a club in both hands at trick 2 (Y/N)
West leads the CQ against 6S. You win in hand. Which card should you play at trick 2?
In 6H, you win the Club queen and cash the heart ace, all following. Which suit should you play at trick 3?
West leads the D4 against 3NT. Which card should you play from dummy?
West leads the H7 against 3NT. True or false: you should play the Ace from dummy. (Y/N)
West leads the HT against 4S. True or false: you should cover in dummy. (Y/N)
West leads the QH against 6S and you win in hand. Which card should you play next?
West leads the HQ against 4S. You win and play which card next?
West leads the S9 against 6H. True or false: you should win the Ace in dummy (Y/N)
West leads the club 3 against 4H. True or false: you should finesse in Dummy (Y/N).
West leads the H7 against 4S. Which card do you play from dummy?
West leads the H5 against 6NT. Which card do you play from dummy?
West leads the CQ against 4S. True or false: you should win dummy (Y/N).
In 6S, you win the CQ lead in hand. True or false: your best line is to immediately play three diamonds and ruff the third round low in dummy. (Y/N)
West leads the DQ against 4S and you win. Which suit should you play next?
Defending 3S, you lead the DA and partner plays the 2. Which card do you play next?

Against 3NT partner leads the D3 to your K. You win and play which card?
Against 4S partner leads three top hearts, dummy ruffing the third round with the S9. Do you overruff? (Y/N)
Against 3NT partner leads the S3, declarer winning your J with the K. He plays the DK to partner's ace, and partner shifts to the H2. You win and play which suit?
Against 4H you cash 3 clubs, partner discarding the D6 on the 3rd round. Which suit do you play next?
Partner leads the S6 against 3NT, declarer having showing 6-10 with a spade stopper. You win the Ace and play which card next?
Against 2D, partner starts with four top spades. Which suit do you play on the fourth spade?
Partner leads the DJ against 4S. You win and play which card?
You lead the CA against 4H, partner playing the 5. Which card do you play next?
You lead the SQ against 4H, holding the trick as partner plays the 8. Which card do you play next?
Partner leads the CJ (denies higher honor) against 4S. You win and play the HQ, winning. Which suit do you play at trick 3?
Partner leads the CQ against 4S. You win the Ace and play which card next?
Against 5C you lead the HA, partner playing the Q. Which suit do you play next?
Against 4S you lead the HJ, partner overtakes and cashes two top hearts. On the third heart, declarer ruffs with the T. Do you overruff? (Y/N)
Against 4S partner plays the SA and a spade to your hand. You cash the CA and partner plays the 8. What suit do you play now?
Against 4S you cash 3 top diamonds, declarer ruffing the 3rd round. Declarer now plays the SK. Do you win? (Y/N)
You lead the DJ against 4S, partner playing the 2. Declarer plays the SK to your ace. Which suit do you play now?
Partner leads the SK against 4NT, then the SQ when this holds the trick. Which card do you discard?
South declares 4S after West preempts 3H. Partner leads the HT to your King, which holds the trick. Which suit do you return?
Against 3NT you lead a top spade, partner playing the 8 (count). Which suit do you play next?
Against 4H, partner leads a low trump. Do you win the Ace? (Y/N)
Against 4S you lead the HQ. Declarer wins in dummy and plays a diamond to his queen and your Ace. Which suit do you play?
Against 4S, partner leads the AK of hearts. Which suit do you play on the second heart?
Against 3NT, the defense starts 3 rounds of spades, declarer winning the third round with the Ace as partner shows 5S. Declarer plays the CQ to your King. Which card do you play next?
Against 4S you lead the CK, partner playing the T. Which suit do you play next?
Against 4S partner leads the HK. Which card you play?
Against 4H you lead a top club, partner playing the 3. Which card do you play next?
Against 2S you lead the HK, partner playing the 2. Which suit do you play next?
Against 4H partner leads the ST. You win the Ace and play which card?
Against 4S you lead the DQ: A, 2, 4. Declarer takes a spade finesse to your King. Which card do you play?
Against 4S partner leads the QH. You win and play which card?
West leads the S6 against 3NT. You win and play which card from dummy?
Against 6H, West leads the QC. You win and play which suit from hand?
Against 3NT, West leads theclubs, East following both times. After winning and finding diamonds 2-2, which suit should you play?
In 4S, West leads the C2: 3, 9, J. Which suit do you play from hand at trick 2?
West leads the SK against 3NT. You win and play the CK and a club towards dummy. Do you finesse? (Y/N)
West leads the S2 against 4H. You win and play which suit?
